description: From French béatifier, from Medieval Latin beātifico (“I bless”).

verbs.description: beatify (third-person singular simple present beatifies, present participle beatifying, simple past and past participle beatified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To pronounce or regard as happy, or supremely blessed, or as conferring happiness.
(transitive, Roman Catholicism) To carry out the third of four steps in canonization, making someone a blessed.
